wrote:
>
> Kyo-kinko i=
s non-Goto (non-Mino, etc.) kinko work from after the 
Momoyama period.  It=
 is often applied to work that is in Goto style 
but is not Goto main or si=
deline work.  Edo-kinko used to be used 
similarly for work in the style of=
 Edo region machibori kinko 
schools, but lately this is generally lumped a=
s "Kyo-kinko" as well.  
So it truly is a grab bag, but the problem (especi=
ally with menuki) 
is that there is so much Edo period kinko work with no u=
nique 
character to it that makes it possible to give a more specific 
attr=
ibution.
> 
> BTW, generic Edo period kinko work of lower quality than Kyo-=
kinko 
is attributed to Kyo-kanagushi.
> 
> Jim
